Participants: Shlomi Fish and Roy Glasverg
Supervisor: Yoram Yihyie
The Computer Networks Lab, Electrical Engineering Department, The Technion
Introduction
Purpose
The purpose of this project was to create a unified and easy to use web-based interface to manage seminars given by various clubs across the Technion. Until now, each club in the Technion had his own ad-hoc way of managing and publishing its seminars, and we were assigned to bring consistency to this scheme.
The code we developed had to be scalable, portable, and easy to maintain. The interface itself had to be accessible, lightweight, and usable.
Platform and Tools
We wrote the code in Perl 5, and ran it on an Apache web-server version 1.3.x using mod_perl. We used a Mandrake Linux 8.2 system for development of the code.
As our database back-end we used MySQL 3.23, and communicated with it by using Perl's DBI interface and the DBD-Mysql module. We made use of several CPAN (Comprehensive Perl Archive Network) modules in our code.
